ukim.finki.mps.delay_function_generator
Class CodeBuilder

java.lang.Object
  ukim.finki.mps.delay_function_generator.CodeBuilder

public class CodeBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

used to generate single instructions, code segments and loops

Author:
Andrej Gajduk

Field Summary
private  InstructionSet instruction_set
          specifies the instruction set, i.e.
private  java.util.ArrayList<InstructionData> instructions_available
          out of all the instructions in the instruction set only a subset are available concerning the elements of the mP our delay function is allowed to use, this array list contains only those instructions, they are the instructions that will be used when generating out delay function
private  Executable[] possible_durations
          an array that contains the instruction codes for all possible build-able durations of code possible_duration[i] == null if the duration i can not be achieved by the available instructions otherwise possible_durations[i] will contain an array list of instructions that last exactly i-states

Field Detail

instruction_set

private InstructionSet instruction_set
specifies the instruction set, i.e. the mP for the delay function

instructions_available

private java.util.ArrayList<InstructionData> instructions_available
out of all the instructions in the instruction set only a subset are available concerning the elements of the mP our delay function is allowed to use, this array list contains only those instructions, they are the instructions that will be used when generating out delay function

possible_durations

private Executable[] possible_durations
an array that contains the instruction codes for all possible build-able durations of code possible_duration[i] == null if the duration i can not be achieved by the available instructions otherwise possible_durations[i] will contain an array list of instructions that last exactly i-states

CodeBuilder

public CodeBuilder()
Method Detail

setInstructionSet

public void setInstructionSet(java.lang.String mP)
set the instruction_set to be of the specified mP

Parameters:
mP - - the mP we will use to set the instruction set

buildDelayFunction

private DelayFunction buildDelayFunction(long min_time,
                                         long max_time,
                                         java.lang.String mP,
                                         Element[] elements_usable,
                                         DelayFunction res,
                                         boolean ret_is_required)
the method to be used for generating delay functions this method will try to make a function with least possible instructions specifies all the input parameters needed

Parameters:
min_time - - lower bound for the duration of the delay function
max_time - - upper bound for the duration of the delay function
mP - - string description for the microprocessor which instruction set should be used
elements_usable - - descriptors for all the elements that are available to the function to operate with, such as registers and memory locations
Returns:
a code segment that is a function, with adequate labels ending in a RET or an equivalent instruction the code segment should have a duration time that belongs in the interval [min_time,max_time] some small probability for changes in duration should be allowed, The delay function used should not be using any other elements other than those explicitly specified by the usable_elemnts array, as an addition the delay function should not be longer than the maximum instruction limit allowed *further notice: the default instruction limit should be dependent on the duration of the delay function required **further notice: the error allowed for the duration of the delay function should be reverse-proportional to the interval size

buildDelayFunction

public DelayFunction buildDelayFunction(long min_time,
                                        long max_time,
                                        java.lang.String mP,
                                        Element[] elements_usable,
                                        boolean ret_is_required)
just used to set the default value of res to null

getInstructionsForDuration

private Executable getInstructionsForDuration(long min_time,
                                              long max_time)
for this function to work the precomputeAllPossibledurations to have been called before

Returns:
- an Executable that has duration in the interval [min_time,max_time]

buildDelayFunction

private Executable buildDelayFunction(long min_time,
                                      long max_time,
                                      Element[] elements_usable,
                                      int instruction_limit)
the method to be used for generating delay functions with specific length of instructions specifies all the input parameters needed

Parameters:
min_time - - lower bound for the duration of the delay function
max_time - - upper bound for the duration of the delay function
mP - - string description for the microprocessor which instruction set should be used
elements_usable - - descriptors for all the elements that are available to the function to operate with, such as registers and memory locations
instruction_limit - - the maximum number of instructions that should be used to achieve the required duration, use -1 if the limit is not specified, and 20 as the default value
Returns:
a code segment that is a function, with adequate labels ending in a RET or an equivalent instruction the code segment should have a duration time that belongs in the interval [min_time,max_time] some small probability for changes in duration should be allowed, The delay function used should not be using any other elements other than those explicitly specified by the usable_elemnts array, as an addition the delay function should not be longer than the maximum instruction limit allowed *further notice: the default instruction limit should be dependent on the duration of the delay function required **further notice: the error allowed for the duration of the delay function should be reverse-proportional to the interval size

buildLoop

private Executable buildLoop(long min_time,
                             long max_time,
                             Element[] elements_usable,
                             int instruction_limit,
                             int nested_loops_counter)
the method stub to be used for generating a loop specifies all the input parameters needed

Parameters:
min_time - - lower bound for the duration of the loop
max_time - - upper bound for the duration of the loop
elements_usable - - descriptors for all the elements that are available to the loop to operate with, such as registers and memory locations
instruction_limit - - the maximum number of instructions that should be used to achieve the required duration, use -1 if the limit is not specified
Returns:
a loop with an execution time that falls in the interval [min_time,max_time] *IMPORTANT NOTICE: this function can and will return nested loop structures when required **IMPORTANT NOTICE -- *** WARNING!!!: this functions breaks the proposed architecture and deals only with 8085 loop structure this should be dealt with in some other manner in the future, perhaps migrate it to the InstructionSet somehow or create an AbstractBuilder

makeLoop

private Loop makeLoop(int loop_type,
                      int init_value,
                      java.lang.String label,
                      java.lang.String reg_or_reg_pair,
                      Executable other_instructions)
a method used to create a loop

Parameters:
loop_type - - type of loop 8bit or 16bit
init_value - - this determines the number of iterations
label - - label used to guide this loop's jumps
reg_or_reg_pair - - string describing which register is used to implement this loop's logic
other_instructions - - some instructions meant to give more duration to the loop, they are all nested
Returns:
- a loop with default init, decr and cond segments and other set

buildLoopByDeterminingInitValue

private Loop buildLoopByDeterminingInitValue(int min_iterations,
                                             int max_iterations,
                                             long min_time,
                                             long max_time,
                                             Element[] elements_usable,
                                             int instruction_limit,
                                             int nested_loops_counter,
                                             java.lang.String reg_or_reg_pair,
                                             int loop_type)
this method is used to generate loops it will try every possible number of iterations in the interval[min_iter,max_iter] for this loop's logic in order to get it's execution time in the interval [min_time,max_time],

Parameters:
min_iterations -
max_iterations -
min_time -
max_time -
elements_usable - - describes all the elements this loop can use for the instruction that are part of the other executable
instruction_limit - - the maximum number of instructions this loop can use for it's code
nested_loops_counter - - keeping track of loop nesting in order to give a unique label for each loop
reg_or_reg_pair - - the register the loop should use to implement it's logic
loop_type - - the type of the loop we are trying to build - 8 bit or 16 bit
Returns:

removeUsedRegisters

private Element[] removeUsedRegisters(Element[] elements_usable,
                                      java.lang.String... registers)
removes the specified register from the array of elements on our disposal, does not change the original array

Parameters:
elements_usable - - current elements that we can use
registers - - the String description of the register elements we need to remove from the array
Returns:
a new array of elements that contain all the elements from the original but with the registers removed

precomputeAllPossibleDurations

private void precomputeAllPossibleDurations(Element[] elements_usable,
                                            int instruction_limit)
this function will take all the arguments, separate the instructions that we can use out of the whole instruction set of the mP with respect to the elements_usable, and will then calculate all possible duration of instructions segments of maximum instructions to instruction limit, and store that information in the possible_durations array

Parameters:
elements_usable - - descriptors for all the elements that are available to the function to operate with, such as registers and memory locations
instruction_limit - - the maximum number of instructions that should be used to achieve the required duration, use -1 if the limit is not specified, and 20 as the default value *notice: the mP that we will use is already set *further notice: the default instruction limit should be dependent on the duration of the delay function required

getMaximumInstructionDuration

private int getMaximumInstructionDuration()
returns the longest possible duration with the current available instructions

Returns:
- duration in T-states of the mP of the longest available instruction

getMaximumNumberofIterationsWhenNestingLoops

private long getMaximumNumberofIterationsWhenNestingLoops(Elements elements)
used to roughly estimate the number of loops we need to get a duration

Parameters:
elements - - elements available for making loops, only the registers are of interest
Returns:
int - the maximum such number - 0 if we can make no loops, known to cause overflow

getMaximumDurationWhenNestingLoops

private long getMaximumDurationWhenNestingLoops(Elements elements)
used to roughly estimate the number of loops we need to get a duration

Parameters:
elements - - elements available for making loops, only the registers are of interest
Returns:
duration in T-states of the mP, the longest we can get by nesting all loops available,0 if no loops

getMaximumPossibleCreatedDuration

private int getMaximumPossibleCreatedDuration()
used when we determine do we need or not a loop in our function

Returns:
- duration in T-states of the mP of the longest created loopless instruction sequence by the method for precomputing the duration , 0 default
